Text.Value: Good. Clear off, then. I'm busy.

EditorData.NodeContext: A bit flustered,she almost accepted a bribe and now wants the conversation done

Text.Value: Steel Watchers make me uneasy. A good weapon in my palm would put my mind at rest.
I'd like to trade with you.
This equipment isn't for sale. It belongs to the Flaming Fist.

EditorData.NodeContext: 'for now, anyway' has bitter edge to it

Text.Value: Trade? Do I look like a shopkeeper?
Fine. Keep your boots on.
Dammit - someone help me!
I don't have anything fancy, but you're welcome to take a look.
Strong folk wielding strong blades. That's what keeps folk safe. Not those glorified golems.

EditorData.NodeContext: Empassioned, but not too loud, in case anyone hears

Text.Value: Can't believe they put that mindless metal mragreshem in my armoury.
Wake up, you useless hunk of junk, I'm being attacked!
Fat lot of use that hunk of junk was. Keeping me 'safe', were you? Useless.

EditorData.NodeContext: partially to self, re steel watcher in the armoury, 'keeping me safe' is sarcastic.

Text.Value: Leave.
You want to spend your gold, find a merchant in the city. My weapons are not for sale!
Show me what you have to trade, istik.
Pleasure doing business with you. Now bugger off.
Seek the cause of her sour mood.
I'll keep that in mind.
I suppose you can take a look. But make it quick.
Huh. Wouldn't think anything round here would bother the likes of you. But you're not wrong.

EditorData.NodeContext: 'Huh' is appraising, she's surprised but ultimately believes you

Text.Value: I'd like to buy the trading licence we discussed. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])
This is the armoury, not a bloody open house. Fists only. Now clear off.

EditorData.logicalname: NOT MET, NO ACCESS, NOT GITH

Text.Value: What is it this time?
What if I were to pay for, say, a 'trading licence' first?
Lord Gortash himself told me to speak with you about my requirements. Were you not informed?
Just checking if that trading licence is still available?
Won't be long before those Watchers are hulking around here again, nosin' in on my affairs.
A gith in my armoury? I don't think so. Clear off.
Dammit, someone help me - this fool's messing in my mind!
A trading licence? Right, right. Yes, I could provide you with one of those, for the, uh, official fee. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

EditorData.NodeContext: Slow to catch on, then playing along

Text.Value: Shhh. Quiet! Someone might be listening...
'Course I bloody wasn't. Too busy ordering more of these mechanical monstrosities to tell me.
Finally, someone who sees sense.
Wake up, you brainless gimcrack! I'm being attacked!
Oi. I told you already - Flaming Fists only in here. Leave. Now.
Here's the gold.
It is, but the er... fee isn't negotiable. Come back when you have the coin.

EditorData.NodeContext: a bit awkward, the 'fee' is a bribe

Text.Value: 'Steel Watchers'. Stupid thing'll probably decapitate me for cleaning the bloody mace rack.
Much appreciated. Take a look around.
The better outfitted I am, the less work there is for you Fists inside the city.
Hrm. Guess anyone can saunter in and make threats now that the Watchers are disabled.
Either you trade with me, or I suggest you start running.
Attack.
No, I wasn't. And if he thinks he can sell off my armoury without telling me... narg mragreshem.

EditorData.NodeContext: Pissed off. Narg mragreshem (NARG mrag-RESH-em) = big shithead.

Text.Value: Leave.
Back again, I see.
I'm not interested. Now get out. I've got work to do.
Trade.
Shhh. Quiet! That rust heap might be listening...

EditorData.NodeContext: quieter, trying not to be overheard (not whispered)

Text.Value: Stay sharp, stranger. In these times, all we can trust are the blades in our hands.

Synopsis:
Dialog with the Flaming Fist Quartermaster, an experienced woman frustrated at the new steel watch unit placed in her armoury.

You need to convince her to allow you to trade with her.
